entry.title: Hosting FreshRSS on fly.io
entry.content:
The problem.

I'm broke, and I like using FreshRSS. Here's how to self-host it on fly.io for free.

The solution.

I assume you already have the account on fly.io.

!NOTE In this guide will be used my modified container with extensions I prefer to have. If you want to use official container feel free to swap ghci.io/olexsmir/freshrss-image to docker.io/freshrss/freshrss. Also feel free to fork and modify github.com/olexsmir/freshrss-image according to your needs.

  1. Create an app on fly.io,
fly app create your_app_name
  1. Create fly.toml file with following contents:
app = 'your_app_name' # TODO: update me  primary_region = 'otp'  kill_signal = 'SIGINT'  kill_timeout = '5s'    [experimental]    auto_rollback = true    [build]    image = 'ghcr.io/olexsmir/freshrss-image:1.27.1'    [env]    CRON_MIN = '*/20'    [[mounts]]    source = 'freshrss_data'    destination = '/var/www/FreshRSS/data'    [[services]]    protocol = 'tcp'    internal_port = 80    processes = ['app']      [[services.ports]]      port = 80      handlers = ['http']      force_https = true      [[services.ports]]      port = 443      handlers = ['tls', 'http']      [services.concurrency]      type = 'connections'      hard_limit = 5      soft_limit = 3      [[services.tcp_checks]]      interval = '15s'      grace_period = '1s'    [[vm]]    memory = '512mb'    cpu_kind = 'shared'    cpus = 1
